titleStmt.title: A true relation of the most prosperous voyage made this present yeere 1605, by Captaine George Waymouth, in the discouery of the land of Virginia where he discouered 60 miles vp a most excellent riuer; together with a most fertile land. Written by Iames Rosier. a gentleman employed in the voyage.
titleStmt.author: Rosier, James, 1575-1635.

titleStmt.title: A true relation of the most prosperous voyage made this present yeere 1605, by Captaine George Waymouth, in the discouery of the land of Virginia where he discouered 60 miles vp a most excellent riuer; together with a most fertile land. Written by Iames Rosier. a gentleman employed in the voyage.
titleStmt.author: Rosier, James, 1575-1635.

publicationStmt.publisher: [Printed at Eliot's Court Press] impensis Geor. Bishop,

notesStmt.note: "The book relates not to Virginia, but to the first exploration of the coast of Maine by the English"--Folger Library catalogue.
Running title reads: The last discouery of the north part of Virginia.
Reproduction of the original in Princeton University Library.
